name: Cholanaickan Tribal Settlement
initiatives: - Eco-tourism development by Kerala Forest Dept & responsible tourism with focus on tribal communities and sustainable resource management.- Forest conservation programs securing forest carbon sinks.- Tribal welfare schemes promoting sustainable livelihoods, indirectly reducing forest resource pressure.
accessibility_info: Not suitable for elderly or wheelchair users; visits only with official permission and guides; not for independent travelers.
food_info: Traditional tribal food includes tubers, wild honey, bamboo rice, and foraged greens
travel_info: 60 km from Nilambur, Kerala. Nearest airport is Kozhikode; nearest railway station is Nilambur Road.
unique_info: One of the last hunter-gatherer communities in South India with extensive knowledge of medicinal plants. Their language is unique and not written down.
history: Home to one of India's most isolated tribes who lived in caves until recently. They are master honey gatherers and forest knowledge experts.
activities: Guided visits to forest periphery with tribal guides; learning about honey collection; medicinal plant walks; cultural exchange programs through government-sanctioned tribal welfare initiatives.
accomodation: No accommodations in tribal areas; stay in Nilambur or nearby areas
events: No public festivals; occasional cultural programs organized by Tribal Department

name: Dong Village
initiatives: - Arunachal Pradesh Forest Department afforestation and forest protection programs.- Community-based eco-tourism involving locals and promoting sustainable environmental practices.
accessibility_info: Challenging for elderly and not wheelchair accessible; inner line permits required; guided tours essential.
food_info: Thukpa; momos; local rice preparations; fermented bamboo shoot dishes; butter tea
travel_info: 50 km from Walong. Nearest airport is Dibrugarh (connection via road/helicopter); permits required for all visitors.
unique_info: First place in India to receive sunlight each morning (around 5:30 AM). Traditional Meyor tribe settlement with unique cultural practices influenced by Tibetan Buddhism.
history: Easternmost village in India where the sun rises first in the country. Located near the tri-junction of India, China, and Myanmar borders.
activities: Experience India's earliest sunrise; village walks; photography; bird watching; learning about Meyor culture; trekking along nearby hills; visit to Dong Monastery.
accomodation: Basic homestays in the village; government inspection bungalow with prior booking
events: Buddhist festivals following Tibetan calendar; Losar celebrations

name: Ziro Valley
initiatives: - Ziro Festival of Music with sustainability focus (waste management, local culture promotion).- Apatani cultural landscape preservation (sustainable agriculture).- Forest Dept projects for forest cover and reforestation.
accessibility_info: Moderate difficulty for elderly; not wheelchair accessible; safe for solo travelers with basic precautions.
food_info: Bamboo shoots with pork; fermented rice beer (apong); smoked meat dishes; fish from paddy fields
travel_info: Nearest airport is Jorhat (Assam) 4 hours away. Helicopter service from Naharlagun to Ziro. Train to Naharlagun then taxi to Ziro.
unique_info: One of India's few rice-cum-fish cultivation systems. The valley has distinctive bamboo and pine forests with picturesque villages.
history: Home to the Apatani tribe known for their unique face tattoos and nose plugs. UNESCO World Heritage Site contender.
activities: Trekking in the valley floor; attending Ziro Music Festival (September); photography of paddy fields; homestay with Apatani tribe; exploring Talley Valley Wildlife Sanctuary.
accomodation: Homestays in traditional Apatani houses; Ziro Valley Resort; few guest houses in Old Ziro and New Ziro
events: Ziro Music Festival (September); Myoko Festival (March); Dree Festival (July)

name: Majuli Island
initiatives: - Riverbank erosion control projects involving afforestation.- Wetland conservation efforts.- Cultural landscape conservation by NGOs focusing on traditional way of life and environment.
accessibility_info: Limited accessibility for disabled visitors; senior-friendly with assistance; safe for solo travelers.
food_info: Assamese thalis with fresh fish; poitabhat (fermented rice); duck meat with ash gourd
travel_info: Ferry from Nimati Ghat (Jorhat) to Kamalabari Ghat. Nearest airport is Jorhat; nearest railway station is Jorhat.
unique_info: Unique tradition of mask-making at Samaguri Satra. The island is gradually eroding due to the Brahmaputra river and may disappear in coming decades.
history: World's largest river island on the Brahmaputra. Center of Assamese neo-Vaishnavite culture with ancient monasteries (satras) dating back to the 15th century.
activities: Visit ancient satras (monasteries); watch mask-making process; bicycle around the island; boat rides on the Brahmaputra; bird watching during winter; cultural performances at satras.
accomodation: La Maison de Ananda; Me:Po Okum; Deka Chang; numerous homestays
events: Raas Leela (November); Paal Naam performances at satras; Ali-Ai-Ligang (February)

name: Champaner-Pavagadh Archaeological Park
initiatives: - ASI conservation and maintenance with sustainable site management.- Visitor management efforts to minimize impact on structures and environment.
accessibility_info: Moderately accessible for elderly; partial wheelchair access in main monuments; solo travel friendly.
food_info: Gujarati thali; dhokla; khandvi; dal dhokli available in nearby small eateries
travel_info: 57 km from Vadodara. Nearest airport and railway station is Vadodara.
unique_info: Only complete unchanged pre-Mughal Islamic city in India. Contains ruins from multiple periods showcasing evolution of architectural styles over 600 years.
history: UNESCO World Heritage Site with structures dating from the 8th to 14th centuries. Ancient Hindu and Jain temples along with Islamic monuments.
activities: Explore Jami Masjid; hike to Pavagadh Hill and Kalika Mata Temple; visit the step wells; photography of ancient structures; archeological explorations of lesser-known ruins.
accomodation: Limited options near the site. Best to stay in Vadodara and make a day trip.
events: Navratri celebrations at Kalika Mata Temple (September/October)

name: Unakoti
initiatives: - ASI protection and maintenance of rock carvings.- Tripura tourism development with cleanliness and green cover efforts.- Forest conservation and afforestation drives.
accessibility_info: Challenging for elderly and wheelchair users due to hillside location and steps; reasonable for solo travelers.
food_info: Traditional Tripuri cuisine; bamboo shoot preparations; berma (fermented fish); chuak (rice beer)
travel_info: 178 km from Agartala. Nearest railhead is Kumarghat (20 km). Nearest airport is Agartala.
unique_info: Features massive 30-foot high bas-relief carvings on a hillside. Legend says these are divine artisans turned to stone after failing to create a crore sculptures in one night.
history: Rock-cut sculptures and stone images from 7th-9th centuries depicting Lord Shiva and other Hindu deities. The name means 'one less than a crore' in Bengali.
activities: Explore the massive rock carvings; photography; meditation in the serene environment; hiking around the forested area; visit nearby waterfalls.
accomodation: Limited accommodations in Kailashahar (12 km away); better options in Agartala
events: Ashokastami Festival (April) when thousands of pilgrims visit

name: Hemis National Park
initiatives: - Snow leopard conservation programs by NGOs and Forest Dept.- Eco-tourism & homestay initiatives promoting sustainable practices.- Waste management campaigns for fragile ecosystem protection.
accessibility_info: Not suitable for elderly or wheelchair users; moderate to difficult trekking; experienced solo travelers only with guides.
food_info: Thukpa; skyu; chhutagi; butter tea; chang (barley beer)
travel_info: 40 km from Leh. Nearest airport is Leh. Entry through organized tours only with permits.
unique_info: One of the best places in the world to spot the elusive snow leopard. Also houses ancient monasteries amid stunning high-altitude Himalayan landscapes.
history: Largest national park in South Asia and home to the endangered snow leopard. Established in 1981 but the area has ancient Buddhist connections.
activities: Wildlife spotting (snow leopards from Jan-Mar); trekking; visit to Hemis Monastery; photography; homestay in traditional Ladakhi houses in Rumbak village.
accomodation: Homestays in Rumbak village; camping during treks; no luxury accommodations inside the park

name: Chettinad
initiatives: - Heritage conservation and restoration using traditional sustainable building methods.- Responsible tourism development preserving customs and artisan livelihoods.- Promotion of local crafts (tiles, textiles, jewelry) sustainably.
accessibility_info: Suitable for elderly with assistance; limited wheelchair accessibility in old mansions; safe for solo travelers.
food_info: Chettinad chicken/mutton; Kavuni arisi (black rice pudding); paniyaram; vegetable kothu; kuzhi paniyaram
travel_info: Nearest airport is Madurai (90 km); nearest railway station is Karaikudi.
unique_info: Mansions built with materials from around the world including Italian marble, Japanese tiles, and Burmese teak. Unique architectural style blending Western and Eastern influences.
history: Historical region known for the palatial houses of the wealthy Nattukottai Chettiar merchant community who traded across Southeast Asia.
activities: Mansion tours in Karaikudi; antique shopping; Chettinad cuisine experiences; photography of architectural details; tile-making workshops; temple visits.
accomodation: The Bangala; Visalam; Chidambara Vilas; Chettinadu Mansion - all heritage hotels converted from original mansions
events: Kothaipongal (January); local temple festivals throughout year

name: Dzukou Valley
initiatives: - Forest fire prevention through local awareness and fire line cutting.- Sustainable trekking guidelines.- Community-led conservation based on indigenous practices.
accessibility_info: Challenging for elderly and not wheelchair accessible; experienced trekkers recommended; guided tours advisable for solo travelers.
food_info: Smoked pork with bamboo shoot; axone (fermented soybean); zutho (rice beer); fish cooked in bamboo
travel_info: Trek starts from Viswema or Zakhama village. Nearest airport and railway station is Dimapur (100 km from Kohima).
unique_info: Famous for its seasonal burst of lilies and rare Dzukou lily found nowhere else in the world. Features uniquely sculpted valleys and rolling hills with dwarf bamboo patches.
history: Valley on the border of Nagaland and Manipur at an altitude of 2450m. Traditional territory of the Angami Naga tribe.
activities: Trekking; camping; photography especially during lily season (May-September); botanizing; star gazing; experiencing Naga culture in nearby villages.
accomodation: Basic accommodations at rest house in the valley; camping; better options in Kohima
events: Hornbill Festival (December) in nearby Kohima; Sekrenyi Festival (February)

name: Gurez Valley
initiatives: - Sustainable tourism development by J&K Tourism Department.- State forest protection programs covering sensitive border regions.
accessibility_info: Not suitable for elderly or wheelchair users; requires security clearances as it's near LOC; solo travel possible but challenging.
food_info: Gurez trout preparations; rajma-chawal; noon chai (salt tea); traditional Dard-Shin dishes
travel_info: 123 km from Srinagar. Nearest airport is Srinagar. Road access only during summer months (May-October).
unique_info: One of the few places where the ancient Shina language is still spoken. Spectacular views of snow-capped Habba Khatoon peak and the Kishanganga River.
history: Remote valley near the Line of Control that was closed to tourists until recently. Inhabited by the Dard-Shin tribe who have preserved their unique culture.
activities: Trout fishing in Kishanganga River; trekking to Tulail Valley; visiting ancient Habba Khatoon tower; photography; cultural exploration of Dard-Shin traditions; homestays.
accomodation: J&K Tourism guest house; homestays in Dawar village; camping options
events: Local folk dance performances in summer; Peer Baba festival at Habba Khatoon shrine

name: Mechuka Valley
initiatives: - Eco-tourism policies minimizing environmental impact.- Border area development programs with sustainable infrastructure principles.
accessibility_info: Not wheelchair accessible; basic facilities only.
travel_info: Nearest airport is Dibrugarh (Assam), then 7-8 hr drive. Permits required.
unique_info: Pristine landscapes, wooden houses, and a unique blend of Buddhist and tribal cultures.
history: A remote valley near the Indo-Tibet border, home to the Memba tribe and a 400-year-old Buddhist monastery.
activities: Trekking, monastery visits, river rafting, explore local villages.
accomodation: Homestays and guesthouses in Mechuka town.

name: Haflong
initiatives: - Urban greening and tree plantation drives.- Solid waste management and cleanliness initiatives.- Conservation efforts for Haflong Lake.
accessibility_info: Good for all ages; some hilly terrain.
food_info: Sticky rice, bamboo shoot dishes, fish curry.
travel_info: Nearest railhead is Haflong Hill; Silchar airport 100 km away.
unique_info: Rolling hills, tribal villages, and orchid gardens.
history: Assam's only hill station, known for its scenic beauty, Dimasa culture, and Haflong Lake.
activities: Boating on Haflong Lake, trekking, visiting Jatinga (famous for bird phenomenon).

name: Tawang Monastery
initiatives: - Continuous maintenance and preservation using sustainable building practices.- Solar power initiatives.- Regular cleanliness drives by local groups.
accessibility_info: Not wheelchair accessible; high altitude.
travel_info: Nearest airport is Tezpur, then 12 hr drive; permits required.
unique_info: Spectacular hilltop setting, rich monastic traditions.
history: Largest monastery in India, founded in the 17th century. Center of Mahayana Buddhism in the region.
activities: Attend morning prayers, explore museum, trek to nearby lakes.

name: Sandakphu
initiatives: - Singalila National Park flora and fauna management.- Eco-tourism regulations for homestays and trekking agencies.- Community-based waste management along trekking routes.
accessibility_info: Not suitable for elderly or wheelchair users.
travel_info: Trek from Manebhanjan (near Darjeeling); nearest airport is Bagdogra.
unique_info: Only place in India to see Everest, Kanchenjunga, Lhotse, and Makalu together.
history: Highest peak in West Bengal, part of Singalila Ridge, offering panoramic views of four of the world's five highest peaks.
activities: Trekking, rhododendron watching, birding.

name: Chopta
initiatives: - "No Plastic" zones enforcement.- Forest protection by Uttarakhand Forest Dept.- Local NGO-led waste management drives.
accessibility_info: Basic guesthouses, some tented camps.
travel_info: Drive from Rishikesh/Haridwar (200 km); nearest railhead is Haridwar.
unique_info: Alpine meadows, rhododendron forests, and Himalayan views.
history: Known as the 'Mini Switzerland of India', Chopta is the base for the Tungnath trek, the highest Shiva temple.
activities: Trekking to Tungnath and Chandrashila, camping, bird watching.

name: Chakrata
initiatives: - Forest protection and afforestation programs.- Waste management improvements by municipal bodies.- Responsible tourism promotion with guidelines.
accessibility_info: Good for families; some sites require trekking.
travel_info: 100 km from Dehradun; nearest airport is Jolly Grant.
unique_info: Secluded hill station with ancient caves and waterfalls.
history: A cantonment town established by the British, surrounded by deodar forests.
activities: Visit Tiger Falls, Deoban, Budher Caves, trekking.

name: Lonar Crater
initiatives: - Conservation of unique lake ecosystem by Forest Dept and NGOs.- Geological heritage site protection.- Local cleanliness drives.
accessibility_info: Some uneven terrain; basic facilities.
travel_info: 150 km from Aurangabad; nearest railhead is Jalna.
unique_info: Only hyper-velocity impact crater in basaltic rock on Earth.
history: A 52,000-year-old meteorite crater lake, surrounded by ancient temples.
activities: Visit Daitya Sudan temple, birdwatching, nature walks.

name: Kaas Plateau
initiatives: - UNESCO World Heritage management including biodiversity conservation.- Visitor management to minimize ecosystem impact.- Ongoing biodiversity research and protection.
accessibility_info: Not suitable for wheelchair users; short walks.
travel_info: 25 km from Satara; nearest airport is Pune.
unique_info: Carpet of wildflowers blooms after monsoon.
history: UNESCO World Natural Heritage Site, known as the 'Valley of Flowers of Maharashtra'.
activities: Photography, nature walks, visit nearby Vajrai Waterfall.

name: Chitrakote Falls
initiatives: - Tourism Board promotion emphasizing sustainability.- Local cleanliness initiatives.- River conservation efforts in Indravati River basin.
accessibility_info: Some steps; not wheelchair accessible.
food_info: Chana sagra, fara, tribal mahua liquor.
travel_info: 40 km from Jagdalpur; nearest airport is Raipur.
unique_info: Spectacular horseshoe-shaped falls in dense forest.
history: India's widest waterfall, called the 'Niagara of India', on the Indravati River.
activities: Boat rides, photography, visit nearby tribal villages.

name: Tso Moriri
initiatives: - Ramsar wetland conservation reserve with Wildlife Dept and community involvement.- Responsible tourism guidelines.- Community-based conservation involving Changpa nomads.
accessibility_info: High altitude; not for elderly or those with health issues.
travel_info: 220 km from Leh; self-drive or taxi; permits required.
unique_info: Pristine blue lake, migratory birds, Changpa nomads.
history: High-altitude lake at 4,522 m, less visited than Pangong, in Changthang plateau.
activities: Photography, bird watching, visit Korzok Monastery.

name: Dholavira
accessibility_info: Some uneven terrain; basic facilities.
travel_info: 220 km from Bhuj; nearest airport is Bhuj.
unique_info: Ancient city ruins with sophisticated water management.
history: One of the five largest Harappan sites in the world, located in the Rann of Kutch.
activities: Explore archaeological site, fossil park, sunset at White Rann.

name: Sualkuchi
accessibility_info: Good for all ages; village roads.
travel_info: 35 km from Guwahati; local buses and taxis available.
unique_info: Traditional looms in every house, Muga and Eri silk production.
history: Known as the 'Manchester of Assam', this village is famed for its centuries-old silk weaving tradition.
activities: Weaving workshops, buy handloom sarees, interact with artisans.

name: Khonoma
accessibility_info: Some hilly paths; basic facilities.
food_info: Smoked pork, sticky rice, bamboo shoot curry.
travel_info: 20 km from Kohima; taxis and shared jeeps available.
unique_info: Community-run eco-tourism, unique forest management.
history: India's first green village, famous for Angami tribe's conservation efforts and terraced fields.
activities: Village walks, birdwatching, learn about Angami customs.

name: Mawlynnong
accessibility_info: Suitable for all ages; some walking.
travel_info: 80 km from Shillong; taxis and shared vehicles.
unique_info: Man-made root bridges, spotless streets, matrilineal Khasi culture.
history: Awarded 'Asia's Cleanest Village', famous for living root bridges and eco-friendly practices.
activities: Walk on root bridges, village tour, visit Sky View platform.

name: Ziro Valley
initiatives: - Ziro Festival of Music with sustainability focus (waste management, local culture promotion).- Apatani cultural landscape preservation (sustainable agriculture).- Forest Dept projects for forest cover and reforestation.
accessibility_info: Moderate difficulty for elderly; not wheelchair accessible.
food_info: Bamboo shoots with pork, apong (rice beer).
travel_info: Nearest airport is Jorhat (Assam), then road to Ziro.
unique_info: Distinctive bamboo and pine forests, Apatani culture.
history: UNESCO World Heritage contender, home to Apatani tribe and their unique paddy-cum-fish farming.
activities: Trekking, homestays, Ziro Music Festival.

name: Keibul Lamjao National Park
accessibility_info: Some boardwalks; not wheelchair accessible.
travel_info: 53 km from Imphal; taxis and buses available.
unique_info: Unique phumdi (floating biomass) ecosystem.
history: World's only floating national park, home to endangered Sangai deer.
activities: Boat rides, wildlife spotting, photography.

name: Phugtal Monastery
accessibility_info: Difficult trek; not accessible for elderly.
travel_info: Trek from Padum (Zanskar Valley); no motorable road.
unique_info: Spectacular architecture, centuries-old Buddhist traditions.
history: A remote cave monastery built into a cliff face, accessible only by foot.
activities: Trek to monastery, interact with monks, meditation.

name: Bhedaghat
accessibility_info: Some steps; not wheelchair accessible.
travel_info: 23 km from Jabalpur; taxis and buses available.
unique_info: Dramatic white cliffs, Dhuandhar Falls, boat rides under moonlight.
history: Famed for marble rocks rising 100 ft above the Narmada River.
activities: Boat ride, cable car, visit Chausath Yogini Temple.

name: Gandikota
accessibility_info: Some rough terrain; not wheelchair accessible.
travel_info: 77 km from Kadapa; nearest railhead is Jammalamadugu.
unique_info: Spectacular red sandstone cliffs on the Pennar River.
history: Known as the 'Grand Canyon of India', with a 13th-century fort overlooking a deep gorge.
activities: Explore Gandikota Fort, kayaking, camping, photography.

name: Lepakshi
accessibility_info: Temple has steps; partial wheelchair access.
travel_info: 120 km from Bengaluru; buses and taxis available.
unique_info: Vijayanagara architecture, legendary murals.
history: 16th-century temple complex with hanging pillar and giant Nandi statue.
activities: Explore temple, photography, learn about legends.

name: Bhimbetka Rock Shelters
accessibility_info: Some uneven terrain; not wheelchair accessible.
travel_info: 45 km from Bhopal; taxis and buses available.
unique_info: Ancient art, natural rock formations.
history: UNESCO World Heritage Site with prehistoric cave paintings dating back 30,000 years.
activities: Guided tours, photography, nature walks.

name: Chilika Lake
accessibility_info: Boat rides accessible; some uneven terrain.
travel_info: Nearest railhead is Balugaon; 120 km from Bhubaneswar.
unique_info: Irrawaddy dolphins, birdwatching, fishing villages.
history: Asia's largest brackish water lagoon, winter home to millions of migratory birds.
activities: Boat rides, birdwatching, visit Kalijai Island.

name: Dzukou Valley
accessibility_info: Tough trek; not for elderly or wheelchair users.
travel_info: Trek from Viswema or Zakhama; nearest airport is Dimapur.
unique_info: Rolling hills, seasonal wildflowers, bamboo groves.
history: Valley on Nagaland-Manipur border, home to rare Dzukou lily.
activities: Trekking, camping, photography.

name: Bhimbetka Rock Shelters
accessibility_info: Some uneven terrain; not wheelchair accessible.
travel_info: 45 km from Bhopal; taxis and buses available.
unique_info: Ancient art, natural rock formations.
history: UNESCO World Heritage Site with prehistoric cave paintings dating back 30,000 years.
activities: Guided tours, photography, nature walks.

name: Chettinad
accessibility_info: Most mansions have steps; some accessible rooms.
travel_info: Nearest airport is Madurai; 90 km by road.
unique_info: Distinctive architecture, antique markets.
history: Region of palatial mansions and unique Chettiar cuisine.
activities: Mansion tours, food trails, tile workshops.

name: Araku Valley
accessibility_info: Some hilly terrain; basic facilities.
travel_info: 120 km from Visakhapatnam; train or road.
unique_info: Waterfalls, caves, tribal culture.
history: Scenic valley in the Eastern Ghats, home to tribal communities and coffee plantations.
activities: Train journey from Vizag, coffee museum, Borra Caves.

name: Haflong
accessibility_info: Good for all ages; some hilly terrain.
food_info: Sticky rice, bamboo shoot dishes, fish curry.
travel_info: Nearest railhead is Haflong Hill; Silchar airport 100 km away.
unique_info: Rolling hills, tribal villages, and orchid gardens.
history: Assam's only hill station, known for its scenic beauty, Dimasa culture, and Haflong Lake.
activities: Boating on Haflong Lake, trekking, visiting Jatinga (famous for bird phenomenon).

name: Gurez Valley
accessibility_info: Not wheelchair accessible; security checks.
travel_info: 123 km from Srinagar; road open May-October.
unique_info: Ancient Shina language, pristine river views.
history: Remote valley near the Line of Control, home to Dard-Shin tribe and Habba Khatoon peak.
activities: Trekking, trout fishing, cultural immersion.

name: Dudhsagar Falls
accessibility_info: Trek is challenging; not wheelchair accessible.
travel_info: 60 km from Panaji; train to Castle Rock or trek from Kulem.
unique_info: Spectacular four-tiered waterfall, accessible by train or trek.
history: One of India's tallest waterfalls, on the Mandovi River in the Western Ghats.
activities: Trekking, swimming, photography.

name: Chandipur Beach
accessibility_info: Beach accessible; some sandy areas.
travel_info: 16 km from Balasore; nearest railhead is Balasore.
unique_info: Unique tidal phenomenon, horseshoe crab sightings.
history: Famous for the 'vanishing sea'-the water recedes up to 5 km during low tide.
activities: Beach walks, seafood, shell collecting.

name: St. Mary's Islands
accessibility_info: Ferry access only; not wheelchair accessible.
travel_info: Ferry from Malpe (Udupi); nearest airport is Mangalore.
unique_info: Columnar lava formations, white sand beaches.
history: Cluster of four small islands with unique hexagonal basaltic rock formations.
activities: Ferry ride, photography, shell collecting.

name: Dhanushkodi
accessibility_info: Sandy terrain; not wheelchair accessible.
travel_info: 20 km from Rameswaram; local jeeps only.
unique_info: Ghost town, mythological Ramayana connection.
history: Abandoned town at the tip of Rameswaram island, destroyed in 1964 cyclone.
activities: Visit ruins, Adam's Bridge viewpoint, birdwatching.

name: Mawphlang Sacred Grove
accessibility_info: Forest trails; not wheelchair accessible.
travel_info: 25 km from Shillong; taxis available.
unique_info: No tree or stone can be removed; unique flora.
history: Ancient forest protected by Khasi tribes for centuries, rich in biodiversity and folklore.
activities: Guided forest walks, learn Khasi rituals.

name: Krem Liat Prah
accessibility_info: Physically demanding; not for elderly or those with claustrophobia.
travel_info: Near Nongjri village, 60 km from Shillong.
unique_info: Stunning stalactites, underground rivers.
history: India's longest natural cave system, over 30 km explored.
activities: Caving (with guides), photography.

name: Auli
accessibility_info: Skiing requires fitness; cable car accessible.
travel_info: 16 km from Joshimath; cable car from Joshimath.
unique_info: Best ski slopes in India, cable car rides.
history: High-altitude ski resort with panoramic views of Nanda Devi and other peaks.
activities: Skiing, trekking, chair lift, camping.
